IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THOSE WE SERVE BY PROVIDING THE HIGHEST QUALITY PERSON CENTERED SERVICE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF THOSE WE SERVE.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL: HOME OF GUIDING HANDS OFFERS MORE THAN JUST A PLACE TO LIVE FOR 178 INDIVIDUALS IN A COMFORTABLE, FRIENDLY LIVING ENVIRONMENT WITH VARYING LEVELS OF INDIVIDUAL SUPPORT AND TRAINING THROUGH 24-HOUR CARE AND SUPERVISION. RESIDENTS LIVE, WORK, ATTEND SCHOOL, AND ENJOY THEIR COMMUNITY IN ONE OF 31 HOMES ACCOMODATING 4 - 6 PEOPLE RANGING IN AGE FROM 8 TO 80. HOMES ARE OPERATED UNDER THE REGULATIONS OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH OR THE DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: RESPITE: FAMILIES CARING FOR THEIR FAMILY MEMBER WITH A DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY OR OTHER CHALLENGE IN THEIR OWN HOME OFTEN HAVE A NEED FOR A FEW HOURS AWAY TO REVITALIZE THEMSELVES IN ORDER TO MEET THE ON-GOING NEEDS OF THEIR FAMILY. HGH'S "IN HOME RESPITE PROGRAM" PROVIDES 1,109 INDIVIDUALS TIME TO ENJOY OUTSIDE ACTIVITIES WITH THE KNOWLEDGE THAT THEIR FAMILY MEMBER IS SAFE AND WELL CARED FOR BY TRAINED STAFF WHO ARE FAMILIAR WITH THEIR LOVE ONE'S PARTICULAR NEEDS. (SAN DIEGO AND IMPERIAL VALLEY)

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: TRANSPORTATION: HGH PROVIDES SPECIALIZED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES FOR INDIVIUDALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WHO ALSO EXPERIENCE SIGNIFICANT PHYSICAL AND /OR MEDICAL CHALLENGES AND OTHER FROM THE SENIOR COMMUNITY. THE FLEET OF 21 ADAPTED BUSES, PRIMARILY MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH DEPT OF TRANSPORTATION 5310 GRANT PROGRAM, TRANSPORTS APPROXIMATELY 350 ADULTS TO VARIOUS "DAY PROGRAMS" IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY ON A DAILY BASIS. CERTIFIED DRIVERS AND TRAINED AIDES ENABLE ADULTS WITH PROFOUND MEDICAL AND OTHER NEEDS TO CONNECT WITH OTHERS IN THEIR COMMUNITY IN A SAFE AND EFFECTIVE MANNER.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT: PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE THERAPEUTIC AND EARLY INTERVENTION FOR APPROXIMATELY 400 CHILDREN AGES 0 TO 3 AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE CHILDREN ARE AT RISK FOR DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS OR WHO MAY BE DIAGNOSED WITH A DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY. CREDENTIALED TEACHERS PROVIDE 1:1 SERVICES IN A CHILD'S HOME OR OTHER NATUAL ENVIRONMENT BENEFITING COGNITIVE AND PHYSICAL DEVELOPMENT; SPEECH AND LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT; SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT; ADAPTIVE DEVELOPMENT AND BEHAVIOR MANAGEMENT. THE EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES (ECDS) PROGRAM INCLUDES AN INFANT DEVELOPMENT ASSESSMENT (IDA) PROGRAM, WHICH ASSESS POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS OF THE ECDS PROGRAM. THE IDA PROGRAM PROVIDED SERVICES TO OVER 1,000 CHILDREN AGES 0-3 DURING THE FISCAL YEAR. THERE ARE ALSO "PARENT PLAY" GROUPS BENEFITING PARENTS AND CHILDREN IN A NUTURING SETTING. (SAN DIEGO AND IMPERIAL VALLEY).

COMMUNITY LIVING PROGRAM: TRAINING, SUPPORT, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL CHALLENGES WHO ARE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY; ADULT FOSTER CARE FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES: MATCHING FAMILY WITH PEOPLE WHO WOULD BENEFIT FROM THIS UNIQUE LIVING EXPERIENCE.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EDUCATING AND IMPROVING AWARENESS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND LEGISLATIVE REPRESENTATIVES ON THE EFFECTS THAT CHANGES TO THE RATE REIMBURSEMENT SYSTEM AND NEW LEGISLATION SUCH AS MINIMUM WAGE INCREASES HAS ON THE ABILITY OF SERVICE PROVIDERS TO DELIVER SERVICES TO PERSONS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND OTHER CHALLENGES. TRAVEL BY CEO TO STATE CAPITAL TO MEET WITH LEGISLATORS.
THE ORGANIZATION HOLDS FUNDS IN TRUST FOR RESIDENTS LIVING IN ITS HOMES TO PAY PERSONAL EXPENSES ON THE RESIDENTS' BEHALF. THESE FUNDS ARE, AND ARE REQUIRED TO BE, HELD IN SEPARATE BANK ACCOUNTS.

BOARD DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE HELD IN 2 SEPARATE ACCOUNTS, CURRENTLY ALL EARNINGS ARE REINVESTED. ONE ACCOUNT IS COLLATERAL FOR A LINE OF CREDIT AND THE OTHER IS HELD IN CASE OF EXTREME FISCAL CRISIS WHERE THE ABILITY TO CONTINUE SERVICES MIGHT BE THREATENED OR FOR EXPANSION OF PROGRAM SERVICES INTO NEW AREAS THAT SUPPORT THE MISSION. THE OTHER ENDOWMENT IS HELD BY SAN DIEGO FOUNDATION AND ONLY THE EARNINGS LESS FEES ARE DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY.

THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C) (3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND SECTION 23701(D) OF THE CALIFORNIA REVENUE AND TAXATION CODE. THE ORGANIZATION, HOWEVER, MAY BE SUBJECT TO TAX ON INCOME WHICH IS NOT RELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE. THE ORGANIZATION HAD NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017. THE ORGANIZATION EVALUATES THEIR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, IF ANY, ON A CONTINUAL BASIS THROUGH REVIEW OF THEIR POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, REVIEW OF THEIR TAX FILINGS, AND DISCUSSIONS WITH OUTSIDE EXPERTS. AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, MANAGEMENT DOES NOT BELIEVE THERE ARE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. AT JUNE 30, 2018, THE FEDERAL STATUTE OF LIMITATION REMAINS OPEN FOR THE 2015 THROUGH 2018 TAX YEARS. THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS FOR THE STATE INCOME TAX RETURNS REMAINS OPEN FOR THE 2014 THROUGH 2018 TAX YEARS.
ANJA HOUSE INCOME 106,825. AQUILLA HOUSE INCOME 105,937. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 312,343.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES 312,343. ANJA HOUSE EXPENSES 125,268. AQUILLA HOUSE EXPENSES 118,280.
GRANTS MADE TO ANJA HOUSE AND AQUILLA HOUSE ARE TO BE USED FOR THE PURPOSE SPECIFIED. NO ONGOING MONITORING OF THE GRANT FUNDS IS DEEMED NECESSARY.
BONUS PAYMENTS ARE MADE BASED ON MEETING ORGANIZATIONAL GOALS AND ARE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

HGH USES A THIRD PARTY CHARITY (501(C)(3)) ORGANIZATION TO PROCESS ALL VEHICLE DONATIONS. THE ORGANIZATION OBTAINS AND SELLS THE VEHICLES, AND PROVIDES THE DONORS WITH FORM 1098-C OR A "THANK YOU" LETTER AS APPROPRIATE ON BEHALF OF HGH. THREE AUTOS WERE CONTRIBUTED IN FY 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM. UPON COMPLETION OF THE DRAFT OF THE RETURN, A COPY WILL BE SENT ELECTRONICALLY TO THE MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT AND BUSINESS MANAGEMENT COMMITTEES AS WELL AS OTHER BOARD MEMBERS NOT ON THOSE COMMITTEES. THEY WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO REVIEW AND ASK ANY QUESTIONS THEY MAY HAVE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, AS WELL AS KEY AND HCP EMPLOYEES WILL REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT LISTING ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS. THESE ARE PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW AND ACCEPTANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO AND CFO ARE DETERMINED BY THE BOARD'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. VARIOUS TOOLS AND RESOURCES ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE REASONABLE COMPENSATION, INCLUDING REVIEW OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATION'S 990'S, SALARY SURVEYS, AND OTHER AVAILABLE MATERIALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, BY-LAWS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
